hero.title: Our Expertise
hero.subtitle: Discover the story of our authentic Italian pizzeria, where tradition meets passion and every pizza tells a story of family heritage and culinary excellence.

section1.title: From Butcher's Counter to Wood Fire
section1.intro: Our story doesn't begin with flour, but with the knife. Before becoming Darius Pizza, our house was an essential address in Cavalaire, founded in 1936. From 1966, it became "Maison Darius", a family butcher shop renowned for its rigor, expertise and uncompromising quality of its products.
section1.conclusion:
In 2020, a new chapter opened. The passion for Italian gastronomy and exceptional products transformed the counter into a wood-fired oven. Maison Darius became Darius Pizza.

The decor has changed, but the soul remains intact. We have preserved the butcher shop's heritage: love for fresh products, respect for artisanal know-how and an obsession with taste. This rigor that we applied to our meats, we now apply to every ingredient that makes up our pizzas.

section2.title: The Secret of an Unrivaled Dough
section2.intro: An exceptional pizza rests on exceptional dough. At Darius Pizza, we leave nothing to chance. Our protocol is a precise balance between science and patience, designed for one goal: to offer you a light, aromatic and perfectly digestible dough.

card1.title: Kneading and Proofing
card1.content: It all starts with controlled hydration and slow kneading. We monitor the temperature of our dough at every moment so as not to "stress" it. This step, the proofing, allows the initial gluten network to develop which will give structure to the dough, while preserving the aromas of our flour.

card2.title: Cold Maturation
card2.content:
This is where the magic happens. Our dough balls rest in the cold at controlled temperature (between 2°C and 4°C) for more than 72 hours. During this long maturation, natural enzymes (proteases) break down the gluten network. Complex protein chains are "pre-digested".

The result for you? Incredibly light, airy and easy-to-digest dough. No more heavy feeling after the meal.

card3.title: The Maillard Reaction
card3.step: Step 3: The Revelation in the Oven
card3.content: During maturation, other enzymes (amylases) transform the complex starch of the flour into simple sugars. During high-temperature cooking, these sugars meet amino acids. This is the famous Maillard Reaction. It doesn't just cook: it caramelizes the dough, creates that golden and spotted crust ("leopard"), and releases an inimitable palette of grilled aromas.

section3.title: Exceptional Products
section3.intro: Exceptional dough demands ingredients worthy of it. Our philosophy is simple: the best, or nothing. This requires rigorous sourcing, whether local, Italian, or from our own heritage.

card1.title: The Flour: Moulin Céard
card1.step: The Character of the Alps: Moulin Céard
card1.content:
The foundation of our dough is our flour. We have chosen Moulin Céard, a family mill in the Hautes-Alpes with expertise passed down since 1820.

They select regional wheats, often Label Rouge, to produce character flour, without additives. This choice gives our dough its rustic flavor and unique ability to flourish during the 72h maturation. This is our commitment to terroir and traceability.

card2.title: The Heritage: Our Charcuterie Expertise
card2.content:
We haven't forgotten where we come from. The heritage of Maison Darius is our intransigence on the quality of meats and charcuterie.

We select our products with the eye and rigor of the butcher: superior white ham, artisanal coppa, fresh meats... This expertise is the guarantee of finding on our pizzas tasty, rich-flavored products that you won't find anywhere else.

card3.title: The Origin: Italian AOP Sourcing
card3.content:
A pizza is a marriage between local and authenticity. For the pillar ingredients of Italian gastronomy, we source directly from the best.

Our tomatoes? San Marzano AOP, sun-drenched at the foot of Vesuvius. Our Mozzarella? Melting fior di latte or genuine Bufala Campana AOP from buffalo milk. Extra virgin olive oil, 24-month Parmigiano Reggiano... We import the sun of Italy.

principles.title: Article 2: PRINCIPLES RELATING TO THE COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA
principles.content: In accordance with Article 5 of European Regulation 2016/679, personal data are:
principles: Processed lawfully, fairly and transparently with regard to the data subject
Collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner incompatible with those purposes
Adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed
Accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date
Kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which they are processed
Processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the collected data
principles.legalBasis: Processing is lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following conditions is met:
legalBasisList: The data subject has consented to the processing of their personal data for one or more specific purposes
Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party
Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject
Processing is necessary to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person
Processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest
Processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: This Cookie Policy explains how Darius Pizza uses cookies and similar technologies when you visit our website. It explains what these technologies are and why we use them, as well as your rights to control our use of them.

whatAreCookies.title: What Are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to website owners.
whatAreCookies.types: Cookies can be 'persistent' (remaining on your device until deleted) or 'session' cookies (deleted when you close your browser).

howWeUseCookies.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUseCookies.content: We use cookies for several purposes:

necessary.title: Necessary Cookies
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function properly. They enable basic functions like page navigation, access to secure areas, and remembering your preferences.
necessary.duration: Duration: Session or up to 1 year

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously. This helps us improve our website performance.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as remembering your language preferences and login status.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies are used to track visitors across websites to display relevant and engaging advertisements.

thirdPartyCookies.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdPartyCookies.content: We also use third-party cookies from trusted partners:
thirdPartyCookies.googleAnalytics: Used to analyze website traffic and user behavior
thirdPartyCookies.googleMaps: Used to display interactive maps and location services
thirdPartyCookies.socialMedia: Used for social media integration and sharing features

managingCookies.title: Managing Cookies
managingCookies.content: You can control and manage cookies in several ways:

browser.title: Browser Settings
browser.content: Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. Here's how to manage cookies in popular browsers:
browser.chrome: Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data
browser.firefox: Firefox: Options > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data
browser.safari: Safari: Preferences > Privacy > Manage Website Data
browser.edge: Edge: Settings > Cookies and site permissions > Cookies and site data

website.title: Website Cookie Settings
website.content: You can also manage your cookie preferences using our cookie consent banner that appears when you first visit our website.

consequences.title: Consequences of Disabling Cookies
consequences.content: If you choose to disable cookies, some features of our website may not function properly. This may affect your ability to place orders, access certain areas of the site, or receive personalized content.
